Description: Most of East Greek pottery plate, mended from seven fragments; on underside four bands; on floor, central floral motif largely lost; broad band outside it with added red and white bands; in frieze at rim alternating rosettes and sets of five rays; repaired.
Curator's comments: Compare a slightly less elaborate piece from Berezan, analytically assigned to Klazomenai(?) (R. Posamentir, 'Funde aus Berezan in St. Petersburg II' Istanbuler Mitteiilungen 57 (2007) 188, fig. 2,7). Similar also is British Museum 1965,0930.530.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 18 O.4, pl. X, no. 8) (possibly)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.143)
